properties.name: align-items

values.name: baseline
values.description: If the flex item's inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

values.name: center
values.description: The flex item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

values.name: flex-end
values.description: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

values.name: flex-start
values.description: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

values.name: stretch
values.description: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

properties.description: Aligns flex items along the cross axis of the current line of the flex container.

values.name: self-start
values.description: The item is packed flush to the edge of the alignment container of the start side of the item, in the appropriate axis..

values.name: center

properties.name: animation

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

properties.name: animation-direction

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

properties.name: animation-duration
properties.description: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

properties.name: animation-fill-mode

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: none
values.description: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

properties.description: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

properties.name: animation-iteration-count

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

properties.description: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

values.name: visible

properties.description: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

properties.name: background

values.name: fixed
values.description: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

values.name: local
values.description: The background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents.

values.name: none
values.description: A value of 'none' counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

values.name: scroll
values.description: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

properties.description: Shorthand property for setting most background properties at the same place in the style sheet.

properties.name: background-attachment

values.name: fixed
values.description: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

values.name: local
values.description: The background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents.

values.name: scroll
values.description: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

properties.description: Specifies whether the background images are fixed with regard to the viewport ('fixed') or scroll along with the element ('scroll') or its contents ('local').

properties.name: background-blend-mode

values.name: normal
values.description: Default attribute which specifies no blending

values.name: multiply
values.description: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.

values.name: screen
values.description: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

values.name: overlay
values.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.

values.name: darken
values.description: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

values.name: lighten
values.description: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

values.name: color-dodge
values.description: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

values.name: color-burn
values.description: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

values.name: hard-light
values.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.

values.name: soft-light
values.description: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.

values.name: difference
values.description: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color..

values.name: exclusion
values.description: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.

values.name: hue
values.description: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: saturation
values.description: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: color
values.description: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: luminosity
values.description: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.

properties.description: Defines the blending mode of each background layer.

properties.name: background-clip
properties.description: Determines the background painting area.

properties.name: background-color
properties.description: Sets the background color of an element.

properties.name: background-image

values.name: none
values.description: Counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

properties.description: Sets the background image(s) of an element.

properties.name: background-origin
properties.description: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

properties.name: background-position
properties.description: Specifies the initial position of the background image(s) (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

properties.name: background-position-x

values.name: center
values.description: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

values.name: left
values.description: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

values.name: right
values.description: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

properties.description: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

properties.name: background-position-y

values.name: bottom
values.description: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

values.name: center
values.description: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

values.name: top
values.description: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

properties.description: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

properties.name: background-repeat
properties.description: Specifies how background images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

properties.name: background-size

values.name: auto
values.description: Resolved by using the image's intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image's intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

values.name: contain
values.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

values.name: cover
values.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

properties.description: Specifies the size of the background images.

If the fourth value is absent, it is the same as the second. If the third one is also absent, it is the same as the first. If the second one is also absent, it is the same as the first. Numbers represent multiples of the corresponding border-width.

values.name: stretch

values.description: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating and left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

values.description: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

values.name: none
values.description: No constraint on the box's position with respect to floats.

values.name: right
values.description: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

properties.syntax: none | left | right | both | inline-start | inline-end
properties.description: Indicates which sides of an element's box(es) may not be adjacent to an earlier floating box. The 'clear' property does not consider floats inside the element itself or in other block formatting contexts.

properties.name: clip

values.name: auto
values.description: The element does not clip.

values.name: rect()
values.description: Specifies offsets from the edges of the border box.

properties.description: Deprecated. Use the 'clip-path' property when support allows. Defines the visible portion of an element's box.

properties.name: clip-path

values.name: none
values.description: No clipping path gets created.

values.name: url()
values.description: References a <clipPath> element to create a clipping path.

properties.description: Specifies a clipping path where everything inside the path is visible and everything outside is clipped out.

properties.name: clip-rule

values.name: evenodd
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.

values.name: nonzero
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

properties.description: Indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Sets the color of an element's text

properties.name: color-interpolation-filters

values.name: auto
values.description: Color operations are not required to occur in a particular color space.

values.name: linearRGB
values.description: Color operations should occur in the linearized RGB color space.

values.name: sRGB
values.description: Color operations should occur in the sRGB color space.

properties.description: Specifies the color space for imaging operations performed via filter effects.

properties.name: column-count

values.name: auto
values.description: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

properties.description: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

properties.name: column-fill

values.name: auto
values.description: Fills columns sequentially.

values.name: balance
values.description: Balance content equally between columns, if possible.

properties.description: In continuous media, this property will only be consulted if the length of columns has been constrained. Otherwise, columns will automatically be balanced.

properties.name: column-gap

values.name: normal
values.description: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

properties.description: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

properties.name: column-rule
properties.description: Shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: column-rule-color
properties.description: Sets the color of the column rule

properties.name: column-rule-style
properties.description: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

properties.name: column-rule-width
properties.description: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

properties.name: columns

values.name: auto
values.description: The width depends on the values of other properties.

properties.description: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

properties.name: column-span

values.name: all
values.description: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appear.

values.name: none
values.description: The element does not span multiple columns.

properties.description: Describes the page/column break behavior after the generated box.

properties.name: column-width

values.name: auto
values.description: The width depends on the values of other properties.

properties.description: Describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

properties.name: contain

values.name: none
values.description: Indicates that the property has no effect.

values.name: strict
values.description: Turns on all forms of containment for the element.

values.name: content
values.description: All containment rules except size are applied to the element.

values.name: size
values.description: For properties that can have effects on more than just an element and its descendants, those effects don't escape the containing element.

values.name: layout
values.description: Turns on layout containment for the element.

values.name: style
values.description: Turns on style containment for the element.

values.name: paint
values.description: Turns on paint containment for the element.

properties.syntax: none | strict | content | [ [ size || inline-size ] || layout || style || paint ]
properties.description: Indicates that an element and its contents are, as much as possible, independent of the rest of the document tree.

properties.name: content

values.name: attr()
values.description: The attr(n) function returns as a string the value of attribute n for the subject of the selector.

values.name: counter(name)
values.description: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

values.name: icon
values.description: The (pseudo-)element is replaced in its entirety by the resource referenced by its 'icon' property, and treated as a replaced element.

values.name: none
values.description: On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements it causes the pseudo-element to have no content.

values.name: normal
values.description: See http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-content/#content for computation rules.

properties.description: Determines which page-based occurrence of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

properties.name: counter-increment

values.name: none
values.description: This element does not alter the value of any counters.

properties.description: Manipulate the value of existing counters.

properties.name: counter-reset

values.name: none
values.description: The counter is not modified.

properties.description: Property accepts one or more names of counters (identifiers), each one optionally followed by an integer. The integer gives the value that the counter is set to on each occurrence of the element.

properties.name: cursor

values.name: alias
values.description: Indicates an alias of/shortcut to something is to be created. Often rendered as an arrow with a small curved arrow next to it.

values.name: all-scroll
values.description: Indicates that the something can be scrolled in any direction. Often rendered as arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle.

values.name: auto
values.description: The UA determines the cursor to display based on the current context.

values.name: cell
values.description: Indicates that a cell or set of cells may be selected. Often rendered as a thick plus-sign with a dot in the middle.

values.name: col-resize
values.description: Indicates that the item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them.

values.name: context-menu
values.description: A context menu is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as an arrow with a small menu-like graphic next to it.

values.name: copy
values.description: Indicates something is to be copied. Often rendered as an arrow with a small plus sign next to it.

values.name: crosshair
values.description: A simple crosshair (e.g., short line segments resembling a '+' sign). Often used to indicate a two dimensional bitmap selection mode.

values.name: default
values.description: The platform-dependent default cursor. Often rendered as an arrow.

values.name: e-resize
values.description: Indicates that east edge is to be moved.

values.name: ew-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional east-west resize cursor.

values.name: grab
values.description: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

values.name: grabbing
values.description: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

values.name: help
values.description: Help is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as a question mark or a balloon.

values.name: move
values.description: Indicates something is to be moved.

values.name: -moz-grab
values.description: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

values.name: -moz-grabbing
values.description: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

values.name: -moz-zoom-in
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

values.name: -moz-zoom-out
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

values.name: ne-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from north-east corner.

values.name: nesw-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional north-east/south-west cursor.

values.name: no-drop
values.description: Indicates that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location. Often rendered as a hand or pointer with a small circle with a line through it.

values.name: none
values.description: No cursor is rendered for the element.

values.name: not-allowed
values.description: Indicates that the requested action will not be carried out. Often rendered as a circle with a line through it.

values.name: n-resize
values.description: Indicates that north edge is to be moved.

values.name: ns-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional north-south cursor.

values.name: nw-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from north-west corner.

values.name: nwse-resize
values.description: Indicates a bidirectional north-west/south-east cursor.

values.name: pointer
values.description: The cursor is a pointer that indicates a link.

values.name: progress
values.description: A progress indicator. The program is performing some processing, but is different from 'wait' in that the user may still interact with the program. Often rendered as a spinning beach ball, or an arrow with a watch or hourglass.

values.name: row-resize
values.description: Indicates that the item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.

values.name: se-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from south-east corner.

values.name: s-resize
values.description: Indicates that south edge is to be moved.

values.name: sw-resize
values.description: Indicates that movement starts from south-west corner.

values.name: text
values.description: Indicates text that may be selected. Often rendered as a vertical I-beam.

values.name: vertical-text
values.description: Indicates vertical-text that may be selected. Often rendered as a horizontal I-beam.

values.name: wait
values.description: Indicates that the program is busy and the user should wait. Often rendered as a watch or hourglass.

values.name: -webkit-grab
values.description: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

values.name: -webkit-grabbing
values.description: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

values.name: -webkit-zoom-in
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

values.name: -webkit-zoom-out
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

values.name: w-resize
values.description: Indicates that west edge is to be moved.

values.name: zoom-in
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

values.name: zoom-out
values.description: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

properties.syntax: [ [ <url> [ <x> <y> ]? , ]* [ auto | default | none | context-menu | help | pointer | progress | wait | cell | crosshair | text | vertical-text | alias | copy | move | no-drop | not-allowed | e-resize | n-resize | ne-resize | nw-resize | s-resize | se-resize | sw-resize | w-resize | ew-resize | ns-resize | nesw-resize | nwse-resize | col-resize | row-resize | all-scroll | zoom-in | zoom-out | grab | grabbing ] ]
properties.description: Allows control over cursor appearance in an element

properties.name: direction

values.name: ltr
values.description: Left-to-right direction.

values.name: rtl
values.description: Right-to-left direction.

properties.description: Specifies the inline base direction or directionality of any bidi paragraph, embedding, isolate, or override established by the box. Note: for HTML content use the 'dir' attribute and 'bdo' element rather than this property.

properties.name: display

values.name: block
values.description: The element generates a block-level box

values.name: contents
values.description: The element itself does not generate any boxes, but its children and pseudo-elements still generate boxes as normal.

values.name: flexbox
values.description: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

values.description: The element generates a block container box, and lays out its contents using flow layout.

values.name: grid

values.description: The element generates an inline-level box.

values.name: inline-block
values.description: A block box, which itself is flowed as a single inline box, similar to a replaced element. The inside of an inline-block is formatted as a block box, and the box itself is formatted as an inline box.

values.name: inline-flex
values.description: Inline-level flex container.

values.name: inline-flexbox
values.description: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

values.name: inline-table
values.description: Inline-level table wrapper box containing table box.

values.name: list-item
values.description: One or more block boxes and one marker box.

values.name: -moz-box
values.description: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

values.name: -moz-inline-box
values.description: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

values.name: -ms-flexbox
values.description: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

values.name: -ms-grid
values.description: The element generates a principal grid container box, and establishes a grid formatting context.

values.name: -ms-inline-flexbox
values.description: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

values.name: -ms-inline-grid
values.description: Inline-level grid container.

values.name: ruby
values.description: The element generates a principal ruby container box, and establishes a ruby formatting context.

values.name: table

values.name: -webkit-box
values.description: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

values.description: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout).

values.name: -webkit-inline-box
values.description: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

values.description: Inline-level flex container.

properties.description: In combination with 'float' and 'position', determines the type of box or boxes that are generated for an element.

values.description: No borders or backgrounds are drawn around/behind empty cells.

values.name: show
values.description: Borders and backgrounds are drawn around/behind empty cells (like normal cells).

properties.name: enable-background

values.name: accumulate
values.description: If the ancestor container element has a property of new, then all graphics elements within the current container are rendered both on the parent's background image and onto the target.

values.name: new
values.description: Create a new background image canvas. All children of the current container element can access the background, and they will be rendered onto both the parent's background image canvas in addition to the target device.

properties.description: Deprecated. Use 'isolation' property instead when support allows. Specifies how the accumulation of the background image is managed.

properties.name: fallback
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a fallback counter style to be used when the current counter style can't create a representation for a given counter value.

properties.name: fill

values.name: url()
values.description: A URL reference to a paint server element, which is an element that defines a paint server: 'hatch', 'linearGradient', 'mesh', 'pattern', 'radialGradient' and 'solidcolor'.

values.name: none
values.description: No paint is applied in this layer.

properties.description: Paints the interior of the given graphical element.

properties.name: fill-opacity
properties.description: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to paint the interior the current object.

properties.name: fill-rule

values.name: evenodd
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.

values.name: nonzero
values.description: Determines the 'insideness' of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

values.description: Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.

values.name: row

values.name: column
values.description: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: column-reverse
values.description: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

values.name: nowrap
values.description: The flex container is single-line.

values.name: row
values.description: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

values.name: row-reverse

values.description: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

values.description: The flexbox is multi-line.

properties.name: float

values.name: inline-end
values.description: A keyword indicating that the element must float on the end side of its containing block. That is the right side with ltr scripts, and the left side with rtl scripts.

values.name: inline-start
values.description: A keyword indicating that the element must float on the start side of its containing block. That is the left side with ltr scripts, and the right side with rtl scripts.

values.name: left
values.description: The element generates a block box that is floated to the left. Content flows on the right side of the box, starting at the top (subject to the 'clear' property).

values.name: none
values.description: The box is not floated.

values.name: right
values.description: Similar to 'left', except the box is floated to the right, and content flows on the left side of the box, starting at the top.

properties.description: Specifies how a box should be floated. It may be set for any element, but only applies to elements that generate boxes that are not absolutely positioned.

properties.name: flood-color
properties.description: Indicates what color to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

properties.name: flood-opacity
properties.description: Indicates what opacity to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

properties.description: Provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

properties.name: font-kerning

values.name: auto
values.description: Specifies that kerning is applied at the discretion of the user agent.

values.name: none
values.description: Specifies that kerning is not applied.

values.name: normal
values.description: Specifies that kerning is applied.

properties.description: Kerning is the contextual adjustment of inter-glyph spacing. This property controls metric kerning, kerning that utilizes adjustment data contained in the font.

properties.name: font-language-override

values.name: normal
values.description: Implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

properties.description: The value of 'normal' implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

properties.name: font-size
properties.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs from the font. For scalable fonts, the font-size is a scale factor applied to the EM unit of the font. (Note that certain glyphs may bleed outside their EM box.) For non-scalable fonts, the font-size is converted into absolute units and matched against the declared font-size of the font, using the same absolute coordinate space for both of the matched values.

properties.name: font-size-adjust

values.name: none
values.description: Do not preserve the font's x-height.

properties.syntax: none | [ ex-height | cap-height | ch-width | ic-width | ic-height ]? [ from-font | <number> ]
properties.description: Preserves the readability of text when font fallback occurs by adjusting the font-size so that the x-height is the same regardless of the font used.

properties.name: font-stretch

values.name: narrower
values.description: Indicates a narrower value relative to the width of the parent element.

values.name: wider
values.description: Indicates a wider value relative to the width of the parent element.

properties.description: Selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font family.

properties.name: font-style

values.name: italic
values.description: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'italic' face, or an 'oblique' face if one is not

values.name: normal
values.description: Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.

values.name: oblique
values.description: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'oblique' face, or an 'italic' face if one is not.

properties.description: Allows italic or oblique faces to be selected. Italic forms are generally cursive in nature while oblique faces are typically sloped versions of the regular face.

properties.name: font-synthesis

values.name: none
values.description: Disallow all synthetic faces.

values.name: style
values.description: Allow synthetic italic faces.

values.name: weight
values.description: Allow synthetic bold faces.

properties.description: Controls whether user agents are allowed to synthesize bold or oblique font faces when a font family lacks bold or italic faces.

properties.name: font-variant

values.name: normal
values.description: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

values.name: small-caps
values.description: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

properties.syntax: normal | none | [ <common-lig-values> || <discretionary-lig-values> || <historical-lig-values> || <contextual-alt-values> || stylistic( <feature-value-name> ) || historical-forms || styleset( <feature-value-name># ) || character-variant( <feature-value-name># ) || swash( <feature-value-name> ) || ornaments( <feature-value-name> ) || annotation( <feature-value-name> ) || [ small-caps | all-small-caps | petite-caps | all-petite-caps | unicase | titling-caps ] || <numeric-figure-values> || <numeric-spacing-values> || <numeric-fraction-values> || ordinal || slashed-zero || <east-asian-variant-values> || <east-asian-width-values> || ruby ]
properties.description: Specifies variant representations of the font

properties.name: font-variant-alternates

values.name: annotation()
values.description: Enables display of alternate annotation forms.

values.name: character-variant()
values.description: Enables display of specific character variants.

values.name: historical-forms
values.description: Enables display of historical forms.

values.name: normal
values.description: None of the features are enabled.

values.name: ornaments()
values.description: Enables replacement of default glyphs with ornaments, if provided in the font.

values.name: styleset()
values.description: Enables display with stylistic sets.

values.name: stylistic()
values.description: Enables display of stylistic alternates.

values.name: swash()
values.description: Enables display of swash glyphs.

properties.syntax: normal | [ stylistic( <feature-value-name> ) || historical-forms || styleset( <feature-value-name># ) || character-variant( <feature-value-name># ) || swash( <feature-value-name> ) || ornaments( <feature-value-name> ) || annotation( <feature-value-name> ) ]
properties.description: For any given character, fonts can provide a variety of alternate glyphs in addition to the default glyph for that character. This property provides control over the selection of these alternate glyphs.

properties.name: font-variant-caps

values.name: all-petite-caps
values.description: Enables display of petite capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.

values.name: all-small-caps
values.description: Enables display of small capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.

values.name: normal
values.description: None of the features are enabled.

values.name: petite-caps
values.description: Enables display of petite capitals.

values.name: small-caps
values.description: Enables display of small capitals. Small-caps glyphs typically use the form of uppercase letters but are reduced to the size of lowercase letters.

values.name: titling-caps
values.description: Enables display of titling capitals.

values.name: unicase
values.description: Enables display of mixture of small capitals for uppercase letters with normal lowercase letters.

properties.syntax: normal | small-caps | all-small-caps | petite-caps | all-petite-caps | unicase | titling-caps
properties.description: Specifies control over capitalized forms.

properties.description: Controls glyph orientation when the inline-progression-direction is horizontal.

properties.name: grid-area

values.name: auto
values.description: The property contributes nothing to the grid item's placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

values.name: span
values.description: Contributes a grid span to the grid item's placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item's grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

properties.description: Determine a grid item's size and location within the grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement. Shorthand for 'grid-row-start', 'grid-column-start', 'grid-row-end', and 'grid-column-end'.

properties.name: grid
properties.description: The grid CSS property is a shorthand property that sets all of the explicit grid properties ('grid-template-rows', 'grid-template-columns', and 'grid-template-areas'), and all the implicit grid properties ('grid-auto-rows', 'grid-auto-columns', and 'grid-auto-flow'), in a single declaration.

properties.name: grid-auto-columns

values.name: min-content
values.description: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: max-content
values.description: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: auto
values.description: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

values.name: minmax()
values.description: Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max.

properties.description: Specifies the size of implicitly created columns.

properties.name: grid-auto-flow

values.name: row
values.description: The auto-placement algorithm places items by filling each row in turn, adding new rows as necessary.

values.name: column
values.description: The auto-placement algorithm places items by filling each column in turn, adding new columns as necessary.

values.name: dense
values.description: If specified, the auto-placement algorithm uses a "dense" packing algorithm, which attempts to fill in holes earlier in the grid if smaller items come up later.

properties.description: Controls how the auto-placement algorithm works, specifying exactly how auto-placed items get flowed into the grid.

values.name: unsafe

values.name: stretch
values.description: If the combined size of the alignment subjects is less than the size of the alignment container, any auto-sized alignment subjects have their size increased equally (not proportionally), while still respecting the constraints imposed by max-height/max-width (or equivalent functionality), so that the combined size exactly fills the alignment container.

values.name: space-evenly
values.description: The items are evenly distributed within the alignment container along the main axis.

values.name: flex-end

values.name: flex-start

values.name: space-around

values.name: normal

properties.name: mix-blend-mode

values.name: normal
values.description: Default attribute which specifies no blending

values.name: multiply
values.description: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.

values.name: screen
values.description: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

values.name: overlay
values.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.

values.name: darken
values.description: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

values.name: lighten
values.description: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

values.name: color-dodge
values.description: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

values.name: color-burn
values.description: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

values.name: hard-light
values.description: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.

values.name: soft-light
values.description: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.

values.name: difference
values.description: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color..

values.name: exclusion
values.description: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.

values.name: hue
values.description: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: saturation
values.description: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: color
values.description: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.

values.name: luminosity
values.description: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.

properties.description: Defines the formula that must be used to mix the colors with the backdrop.

properties.name: -moz-background-inline-policy
properties.description: In Gecko-based applications like Firefox, the -moz-background-inline-policy CSS property specifies how the background image of an inline element is determined when the content of the inline element wraps onto multiple lines. The choice of position has significant effects on repetition.

properties.name: -moz-background-origin
properties.description: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

properties.name: -moz-border-image

values.name: auto
values.description: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.description: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: repeat
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

values.name: round
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The image is stretched to fill the area.

properties.description: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: -moz-border-right-colors
properties.description: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

properties.name: -moz-border-top-colors

properties.name: -moz-box-align

values.name: baseline
values.description: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

values.name: center
values.description: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

properties.description: Specifies how a XUL box aligns its contents across (perpendicular to) the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

properties.name: -moz-box-direction

values.name: normal
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

values.name: reverse
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

properties.description: Specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

properties.name: -moz-box-flex
properties.description: Specifies how a box grows to fill the box that contains it, in the direction of the containing box's layout.

properties.name: -moz-box-flexgroup
properties.description: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

properties.name: -moz-box-ordinal-group
properties.description: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

properties.name: -moz-box-orient

values.name: block-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented along the box's axis.

values.name: horizontal
values.description: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

values.name: inline-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented vertically.

values.name: vertical
values.description: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

properties.description: In Mozilla applications, -moz-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

properties.name: -moz-box-pack

values.name: center
values.description: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

values.name: justify
values.description: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

properties.description: Specifies how a box packs its contents in the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

properties.name: -moz-box-sizing

values.name: border-box

values.name: content-box
values.description: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

values.name: padding-box
values.description: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the padding box of the element.

properties.description: Box Model addition in CSS3.

values.name: normal

properties.description: Provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

values.name: auto
values.description: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

values.name: manual

properties.description: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

properties.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

values.name: justify

values.name: right
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

properties.description: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

values.name: none

values.name: overline
values.description: Each line of text has a line above it.

values.name: underline
values.description: Each line of text is underlined.

properties.name: -moz-text-decoration-style

values.name: dashed
values.description: Produces a dashed line style.

values.name: dotted

values.name: double
values.description: Produces a double line.

values.name: none

values.name: solid

values.name: wavy
values.description: Produces a wavy line.

values.name: none

properties.name: -moz-transform

values.name: matrix()
values.description: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

values.name: matrix3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

values.name: perspective
values.description: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

values.name: rotate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale()
values.description: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: skew()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

values.name: skewX()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

values.name: skewY()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

values.name: translate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.name: -moz-transform-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

values.name: mandatory
