properties.name: -o-transform

values.name: matrix()
values.description: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

values.name: matrix3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

values.name: rotate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale()
values.description: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: skew()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

values.name: skewX()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

values.name: skewY()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

values.name: translate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.name: -o-transform-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

properties.name: -o-transition

values.name: all
values.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

properties.name: -o-transition-delay
properties.description: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

properties.name: -o-transition-duration
properties.description: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

properties.name: -o-transition-property

values.name: all
values.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

properties.name: -o-transition-timing-function
properties.description: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

properties.name: offset-block-end

values.name: auto
values.description: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

properties.description: Logical 'bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: offset-block-start

values.name: auto
values.description: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

properties.description: Logical 'top'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: offset-inline-end

values.name: auto
values.description: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

properties.description: Logical 'right'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: offset-inline-start

values.name: auto
values.description: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

properties.description: Logical 'left'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: outline

values.name: auto
values.description: Permits the user agent to render a custom outline style, typically the default platform style.

values.name: invert
values.description: Performs a color inversion on the pixels on the screen.

properties.description: Shorthand property for 'outline-style', 'outline-width', and 'outline-color'.

properties.name: outline-color

values.name: invert
values.description: Performs a color inversion on the pixels on the screen.

properties.description: The color of the outline.

properties.name: outline-offset
properties.description: Offset the outline and draw it beyond the border edge.

properties.name: outline-style

values.name: auto
values.description: Permits the user agent to render a custom outline style, typically the default platform style.

properties.description: Style of the outline.

properties.name: outline-width
properties.description: Width of the outline.

properties.name: overflow

values.name: auto
values.description: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

values.name: hidden
values.description: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

values.name: -moz-hidden-unscrollable
values.description: Same as the standardized 'clip', except doesn't establish a block formatting context.

values.name: scroll
values.description: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

values.name: visible
values.description: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

properties.description: Shorthand for setting 'overflow-x' and 'overflow-y'.

properties.name: overflow-wrap

values.name: break-word
values.description: An otherwise unbreakable sequence of characters may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

values.name: normal
values.description: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

values.name: anywhere
values.description: There is a soft wrap opportunity around every typographic character unit, including around any punctuation character or preserved white spaces, or in the middle of words, disregarding any prohibition against line breaks, even those introduced by characters with the GL, WJ, or ZWJ line breaking classes or mandated by the word-break property.

properties.description: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit within the line box.

properties.name: overflow-x

values.name: auto
values.description: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

values.name: hidden
values.description: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

values.name: scroll
values.description: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

values.name: visible
values.description: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

properties.description: Specifies the handling of overflow in the horizontal direction.

properties.name: overflow-y

values.name: auto
values.description: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

values.name: hidden
values.description: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

values.name: scroll
values.description: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

values.name: visible
values.description: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

properties.description: Specifies the handling of overflow in the vertical direction.

properties.name: pad
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a "fixed-width" counter style, where representations shorter than the pad value are padded with a particular <symbol>

properties.name: padding
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-bottom
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-block-end
properties.description: Logical 'padding-bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: padding-block-start
properties.description: Logical 'padding-top'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: padding-inline-end
properties.description: Logical 'padding-right'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: padding-inline-start
properties.description: Logical 'padding-left'. Mapping depends on the parent element's 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

properties.name: padding-left
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-right
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: padding-top
properties.description: Shorthand property to set values for the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

properties.name: page-break-after

values.name: always
values.description: Always force a page break after the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.description: Neither force nor forbid a page break after generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.description: Avoid a page break after the generated box.

values.name: left
values.description: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: right
values.description: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

properties.syntax: auto | always | avoid | left | right | recto | verso
properties.description: Defines rules for page breaks after an element.

properties.name: page-break-before

values.name: always
values.description: Always force a page break before the generated box.

values.name: auto
values.description: Neither force nor forbid a page break before the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.description: Avoid a page break before the generated box.

values.name: left
values.description: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

values.name: right
values.description: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

properties.syntax: auto | always | avoid | left | right | recto | verso
properties.description: Defines rules for page breaks before an element.

properties.name: page-break-inside

values.name: auto
values.description: Neither force nor forbid a page break inside the generated box.

values.name: avoid
values.description: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

properties.description: Defines rules for page breaks inside an element.

properties.name: paint-order

values.name: normal
values.description: The element is painted with the standard order of painting operations: the 'fill' is painted first, then its 'stroke' and finally its markers.

properties.description: Controls the order that the three paint operations that shapes and text are rendered with: their fill, their stroke and any markers they might have.

properties.name: perspective

values.name: none
values.description: No perspective transform is applied.

properties.description: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

properties.name: perspective-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

properties.name: pointer-events

values.name: all
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over either the interior or the perimeter of the element.

values.name: fill
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over the interior of the element.

values.name: none
values.description: The given element does not receive pointer events.

values.name: painted
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the pointer is over a "painted" area.

values.name: stroke
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over the perimeter of the element.

values.name: visible
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the 'visibility' property is set to visible and the pointer is over either the interior or the perimeter of the element.

values.name: visibleFill
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the 'visibility' property is set to visible and when the pointer is over the interior of the element.

values.name: visiblePainted
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the 'visibility' property is set to visible and when the pointer is over a 'painted' area.

values.name: visibleStroke
values.description: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the 'visibility' property is set to visible and when the pointer is over the perimeter of the element.

properties.syntax: auto | none | visiblePainted | visibleFill | visibleStroke | visible | painted | fill | stroke | all | inherit
properties.description: Specifies under what circumstances a given element can be the target element for a pointer event.

properties.name: position

values.name: absolute
values.description: The box's position (and possibly size) is specified with the 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties. These properties specify offsets with respect to the box's 'containing block'.

values.name: fixed
values.description: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model, but in addition, the box is fixed with respect to some reference. As with the 'absolute' model, the box's margins do not collapse with any other margins.

values.name: -ms-page
values.description: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model.

values.name: relative
values.description: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow (this is called the position in normal flow). Then the box is offset relative to its normal position.

values.name: static
values.description: The box is a normal box, laid out according to the normal flow. The 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties do not apply.

values.name: sticky
values.description: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow. Then the box is offset relative to its flow root and containing block and in all cases, including table elements, does not affect the position of any following boxes.

values.name: -webkit-sticky
values.description: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow. Then the box is offset relative to its flow root and containing block and in all cases, including table elements, does not affect the position of any following boxes.

properties.description: The position CSS property sets how an element is positioned in a document. The top, right, bottom, and left properties determine the final location of positioned elements.

properties.name: prefix
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a <symbol> that is prepended to the marker representation.

properties.name: quotes

values.name: none
values.description: The 'open-quote' and 'close-quote' values of the 'content' property produce no quotations marks, as if they were 'no-open-quote' and 'no-close-quote' respectively.

properties.description: Specifies quotation marks for any number of embedded quotations.

properties.name: range

values.name: auto
values.description: The range depends on the counter system.

values.name: infinite
values.description: If used as the first value in a range, it represents negative infinity; if used as the second value, it represents positive infinity.

properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Defines the ranges over which the counter style is defined.

properties.name: resize

values.name: both
values.description: The UA presents a bidirectional resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust both the height and the width of the element.

values.name: horizontal
values.description: The UA presents a unidirectional horizontal resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the width of the element.

values.name: none
values.description: The UA does not present a resizing mechanism on the element, and the user is given no direct manipulation mechanism to resize the element.

values.name: vertical
values.description: The UA presents a unidirectional vertical resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the height of the element.

properties.syntax: none | both | horizontal | vertical | block | inline
properties.description: Specifies whether or not an element is resizable by the user, and if so, along which axis/axes.

properties.name: right

values.name: auto
values.description: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

properties.description: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's right margin edge is offset to the left of the right edge of the box's 'containing block'.

properties.name: ruby-align

values.name: auto
values.description: The user agent determines how the ruby contents are aligned. This is the initial value.

values.name: center
values.description: The ruby content is centered within its box.

values.name: distribute-letter
values.description: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the base, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the base, with the first and last ruby text glyphs lining up with the corresponding first and last base glyphs. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the base, then the letters of the base are evenly distributed across the width of the ruby text.

values.name: distribute-space
values.description: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the base, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the base, with a certain amount of white space preceding the first and following the last character in the ruby text. That amount of white space is normally equal to half the amount of inter-character space of the ruby text.

values.name: left
values.description: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

values.name: line-edge
values.description: If the ruby text is not adjacent to a line edge, it is aligned as in 'auto'. If it is adjacent to a line edge, then it is still aligned as in auto, but the side of the ruby text that touches the end of the line is lined up with the corresponding edge of the base.

values.name: right
values.description: The ruby text content is aligned with the end edge of the base.

values.name: start
values.description: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

values.name: space-between
values.description: The ruby content expands as defined for normal text justification (as defined by 'text-justify'),

values.name: space-around
values.description: As for 'space-between' except that there exists an extra justification opportunities whose space is distributed half before and half after the ruby content.

properties.description: Specifies how text is distributed within the various ruby boxes when their contents do not exactly fill their respective boxes.

properties.name: ruby-overhang

values.name: auto
values.description: The ruby text can overhang text adjacent to the base on either side. This is the initial value.

values.name: end
values.description: The ruby text can overhang the text that follows it.

values.name: none
values.description: The ruby text cannot overhang any text adjacent to its base, only its own base.

values.name: start
values.description: The ruby text can overhang the text that precedes it.

properties.description: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

properties.name: ruby-position

values.name: after
values.description: The ruby text appears after the base. This is a relatively rare setting used in ideographic East Asian writing systems, most easily found in educational text.

values.name: before
values.description: The ruby text appears before the base. This is the most common setting used in ideographic East Asian writing systems.

values.name: right
values.description: The ruby text appears on the right of the base. Unlike 'before' and 'after', this value is not relative to the text flow direction.

properties.description: Used by the parent of elements with display: ruby-text to control the position of the ruby text with respect to its base.

properties.name: ruby-span

values.name: attr(x)
values.description: The value of attribute 'x' is a string value. The string value is evaluated as a <number> to determine the number of ruby base elements to be spanned by the annotation element.

values.name: none
values.description: No spanning. The computed value is '1'.

properties.description: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

properties.name: scrollbar-3dlight-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

properties.name: scrollbar-arrow-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the arrow elements of a scroll arrow.

properties.name: scrollbar-base-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the main elements of a scroll bar, which include the scroll box, track, and scroll arrows.

properties.name: scrollbar-darkshadow-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.

properties.name: scrollbar-face-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

properties.name: scrollbar-highlight-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

properties.name: scrollbar-shadow-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

properties.name: scrollbar-track-color
properties.description: Determines the color of the track element of a scroll bar.

properties.name: scroll-behavior

values.name: auto
values.description: Scrolls in an instant fashion.

values.name: smooth
values.description: Scrolls in a smooth fashion using a user-agent-defined timing function and time period.

properties.description: Specifies the scrolling behavior for a scrolling box, when scrolling happens due to navigation or CSSOM scrolling APIs.

properties.name: scroll-snap-coordinate

values.name: none
values.description: Specifies that this element does not contribute a snap point.

properties.description: Defines the x and y coordinate within the element which will align with the nearest ancestor scroll container's snap-destination for the respective axis.

properties.name: scroll-snap-destination
properties.description: Define the x and y coordinate within the scroll container's visual viewport which element snap points will align with.

properties.name: scroll-snap-points-x

values.name: none
values.description: No snap points are defined by this scroll container.

values.name: repeat()
values.description: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container's relevant start edge.

properties.description: Defines the positioning of snap points along the x axis of the scroll container it is applied to.

properties.name: scroll-snap-points-y

values.name: none
values.description: No snap points are defined by this scroll container.

values.name: repeat()
values.description: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container's relevant start edge.

properties.description: Defines the positioning of snap points along the y axis of the scroll container it is applied to.

properties.name: scroll-snap-type

values.name: none
values.description: The visual viewport of this scroll container must ignore snap points, if any, when scrolled.

values.name: mandatory
values.description: The visual viewport of this scroll container is guaranteed to rest on a snap point when there are no active scrolling operations.

values.name: proximity
values.description: The visual viewport of this scroll container may come to rest on a snap point at the termination of a scroll at the discretion of the UA given the parameters of the scroll.

properties.syntax: none | [ x | y | block | inline | both ] [ mandatory | proximity ]?
properties.description: Defines how strictly snap points are enforced on the scroll container.

properties.name: shape-image-threshold
properties.description: Defines the alpha channel threshold used to extract the shape using an image. A value of 0.5 means that the shape will enclose all the pixels that are more than 50% opaque.

properties.name: shape-margin
properties.description: Adds a margin to a 'shape-outside'. This defines a new shape that is the smallest contour that includes all the points that are the 'shape-margin' distance outward in the perpendicular direction from a point on the underlying shape.

properties.name: shape-outside

values.name: margin-box
values.description: The background is painted within (clipped to) the margin box.

values.name: none
values.description: The float area is unaffected.

properties.description: Specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

properties.name: shape-rendering

values.name: auto
values.description: Suppresses aural rendering.

values.name: crispEdges
values.description: Emphasize the contrast between clean edges of artwork over rendering speed and geometric precision.

values.name: geometricPrecision
values.description: Emphasize geometric precision over speed and crisp edges.

values.name: optimizeSpeed
values.description: Emphasize rendering speed over geometric precision and crisp edges.

properties.description: Provides hints about what tradeoffs to make as it renders vector graphics elements such as <path> elements and basic shapes such as circles and rectangles.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size CSS at-rule descriptor, used with the @page at-rule, defines the size and orientation of the box which is used to represent a page. Most of the time, this size corresponds to the target size of the printed page if applicable.

properties.name: src

values.name: url()
values.description: Reference font by URL

values.name: format()
values.description: Optional hint describing the format of the font resource.

values.name: local()
values.description: Format-specific string that identifies a locally available copy of a given font.

properties.description: @font-face descriptor. Specifies the resource containing font data. It is required, whether the font is downloadable or locally installed.

properties.name: stop-color
properties.description: Indicates what color to use at that gradient stop.

properties.name: stop-opacity
properties.description: Defines the opacity of a given gradient stop.

properties.name: stroke

values.name: url()
values.description: A URL reference to a paint server element, which is an element that defines a paint server: 'hatch', 'linearGradient', 'mesh', 'pattern', 'radialGradient' and 'solidcolor'.

values.name: none
values.description: No paint is applied in this layer.

properties.description: Paints along the outline of the given graphical element.

properties.name: stroke-dasharray

values.name: none
values.description: Indicates that no dashing is used.

properties.description: Controls the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths.

properties.name: stroke-dashoffset
properties.description: Specifies the distance into the dash pattern to start the dash.

properties.name: stroke-linecap

values.name: butt
values.description: Indicates that the stroke for each subpath does not extend beyond its two endpoints.

values.name: round
values.description: Indicates that at each end of each subpath, the shape representing the stroke will be extended by a half circle with a radius equal to the stroke width.

values.name: square
values.description: Indicates that at the end of each subpath, the shape representing the stroke will be extended by a rectangle with the same width as the stroke width and whose length is half of the stroke width.

properties.description: Specifies the shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked.

properties.name: stroke-linejoin

values.name: bevel
values.description: Indicates that a bevelled corner is to be used to join path segments.

values.name: miter
values.description: Indicates that a sharp corner is to be used to join path segments.

values.name: round
values.description: Indicates that a round corner is to be used to join path segments.

properties.description: Specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths or basic shapes when they are stroked.

properties.name: stroke-miterlimit
properties.description: When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for 'stroke-linejoin', it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path.

properties.name: stroke-opacity
properties.description: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to stroke the current object.

properties.name: stroke-width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the stroke on the current object.

properties.name: suffix
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a <symbol> that is appended to the marker representation.

properties.name: system

values.name: additive
values.description: Represents "sign-value" numbering systems, which, rather than using reusing digits in different positions to change their value, define additional digits with much larger values, so that the value of the number can be obtained by adding all the digits together.

values.name: alphabetic
values.description: Interprets the list of counter symbols as digits to an alphabetic numbering system, similar to the default lower-alpha counter style, which wraps from "a", "b", "c", to "aa", "ab", "ac".

values.name: cyclic
values.description: Cycles repeatedly through its provided symbols, looping back to the beginning when it reaches the end of the list.

values.name: extends
values.description: Use the algorithm of another counter style, but alter other aspects.

values.name: fixed
values.description: Runs through its list of counter symbols once, then falls back.

values.name: numeric
values.description: interprets the list of counter symbols as digits to a "place-value" numbering system, similar to the default 'decimal' counter style.

values.name: symbolic
values.description: Cycles repeatedly through its provided symbols, doubling, tripling, etc. the symbols on each successive pass through the list.

properties.syntax: cyclic | numeric | alphabetic | symbolic | additive | [ fixed <integer>? ] | [ extends <counter-style-name> ]
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies which algorithm will be used to construct the counter's representation based on the counter value.

properties.name: symbols
properties.description: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies the symbols used by the marker-construction algorithm specified by the system descriptor.

properties.name: table-layout

values.name: auto
values.description: Use any automatic table layout algorithm.

values.name: fixed
values.description: Use the fixed table layout algorithm.

properties.description: Controls the algorithm used to lay out the table cells, rows, and columns.

properties.name: tab-size
properties.description: Determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered.

properties.name: text-align

values.name: center
values.description: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: end
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

values.name: justify
values.description: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: start
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

properties.syntax: start | end | left | right | center | justify | match-parent
properties.description: Describes how inline contents of a block are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill the line box.

properties.name: text-align-last

values.name: auto
values.description: Content on the affected line is aligned per 'text-align' unless 'text-align' is set to 'justify', in which case it is 'start-aligned'.

values.name: center
values.description: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

values.name: justify
values.description: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

values.name: left
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

values.name: right
values.description: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

properties.syntax: auto | start | end | left | right | center | justify
properties.description: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

properties.name: text-anchor

values.name: end
values.description: The rendered characters are aligned such that the end of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

values.name: middle
values.description: The rendered characters are aligned such that the geometric middle of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

values.name: start
values.description: The rendered characters are aligned such that the start of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

properties.description: Used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point.

properties.name: text-decoration

values.name: dashed
values.description: Produces a dashed line style.

values.name: dotted
values.description: Produces a dotted line.

values.name: double
values.description: Produces a double line.

values.name: line-through
values.description: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

values.name: none
values.description: Produces no line.

values.name: overline
values.description: Each line of text has a line above it.

values.name: solid
values.description: Produces a solid line.

values.name: underline
values.description: Each line of text is underlined.

values.name: wavy
values.description: Produces a wavy line.

properties.description: Decorations applied to font used for an element's text.

properties.name: text-decoration-color
properties.description: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.

properties.name: text-decoration-line

values.name: line-through
values.description: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

values.name: none
values.description: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

values.name: overline
values.description: Each line of text has a line above it.

values.name: underline
values.description: Each line of text is underlined.

properties.syntax: none | [ underline || overline || line-through || blink ] | spelling-error | grammar-error
properties.description: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.

properties.name: text-decoration-style

values.name: dashed
values.description: Produces a dashed line style.

values.name: dotted
values.description: Produces a dotted line.

values.name: double
values.description: Produces a double line.

values.name: none
values.description: Produces no line.

values.name: solid
values.description: Produces a solid line.

values.name: wavy
values.description: Produces a wavy line.

properties.description: Specifies the line style for underline, line-through and overline text decoration.

properties.name: text-indent
properties.description: Specifies the indentation applied to lines of inline content in a block. The indentation only affects the first line of inline content in the block unless the 'hanging' keyword is specified, in which case it affects all lines except the first.

properties.name: text-justify

values.name: auto
values.description: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

values.name: distribute
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.

values.name: inter-cluster
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in clustered scripts. This value is typically used for Southeast Asian scripts such as Thai.

values.name: inter-ideograph
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at inter-graphemic boundaries in scripts that use no word spaces. This value is typically used for CJK languages.

values.name: inter-word
values.description: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators. This value is typically used for languages that separate words using spaces, like English or (sometimes) Korean.

values.name: kashida
values.description: Justification primarily stretches Arabic and related scripts through the use of kashida or other calligraphic elongation.

properties.description: Selects the justification algorithm used when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'. The property applies to block containers, but the UA may (but is not required to) also support it on inline elements.

properties.name: text-orientation

values.name: sideways
values.description: This value is equivalent to 'sideways-right' in 'vertical-rl' writing mode and equivalent to 'sideways-left' in 'vertical-lr' writing mode.

values.name: sideways-right
values.description: In vertical writing modes, this causes text to be set as if in a horizontal layout, but rotated 90Â° clockwise.

values.name: upright
values.description: In vertical writing modes, characters from horizontal-only scripts are rendered upright, i.e. in their standard horizontal orientation.

properties.description: Specifies the orientation of text within a line.

properties.name: text-overflow

values.name: clip
values.description: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

values.name: ellipsis
values.description: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

properties.description: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping.

properties.name: text-rendering

values.name: geometricPrecision
values.description: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize geometric precision over legibility and rendering speed.

values.name: optimizeLegibility
values.description: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize legibility over rendering speed and geometric precision.

values.name: optimizeSpeed
values.description: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize rendering speed over legibility and geometric precision.

properties.description: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about what tradeoffs to make as it renders text. The 'text-rendering' property provides these hints.

properties.name: text-shadow

values.name: none
values.description: No shadow.

properties.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element.

properties.name: text-transform

values.name: capitalize
values.description: Puts the first typographic letter unit of each word in titlecase.

values.name: lowercase
values.description: Puts all letters in lowercase.

values.name: none
values.description: No effects.

values.name: uppercase
values.description: Puts all letters in uppercase.

properties.syntax: none | [ capitalize | uppercase | lowercase ] || full-width || full-size-kana | math-auto
properties.description: Controls capitalization effects of an element's text.

properties.name: text-underline-position

values.name: auto
values.description: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline's position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

values.name: below
values.description: The underline is aligned with the under edge of the element's content box.

properties.description: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements. This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text

properties.name: top

values.name: auto
values.description: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

properties.description: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's top margin edge is offset below the top edge of the box's 'containing block'.

properties.name: touch-action

values.name: auto
values.description: The user agent may determine any permitted touch behaviors for touches that begin on the element.

values.name: manipulation
values.description: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of scrolling and continuous zooming.

values.name: none
values.description: Touches that begin on the element must not trigger default touch behaviors.

values.name: pan-x
values.description: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of horizontally scrolling the element's nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

values.name: pan-y
values.description: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of vertically scrolling the element's nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

properties.syntax: auto | none | [ [ pan-x | pan-left | pan-right ] || [ pan-y | pan-up | pan-down ] || pinch-zoom ] | manipulation
properties.description: Determines whether touch input may trigger default behavior supplied by user agent.

properties.name: transform

values.name: matrix()
values.description: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

values.name: matrix3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

values.name: perspective()
values.description: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

values.name: rotate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale()
values.description: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: skew()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

values.name: skewX()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

values.name: skewY()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

values.name: translate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.name: transform-origin
properties.syntax: [ <length-percentage> | left | center | right | top | bottom ] | [ [ <length-percentage> | left | center | right ] && [ <length-percentage> | top | center | bottom ] ] <length>?
properties.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

properties.name: transform-style

values.name: flat
values.description: All children of this element are rendered flattened into the 2D plane of the element.

values.name: preserve-3d
values.description: Flattening is not performed, so children maintain their position in 3D space.

properties.description: Defines how nested elements are rendered in 3D space.

properties.name: transition

values.name: all
values.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

properties.name: transition-delay
properties.description: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

properties.name: transition-duration
properties.description: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

properties.name: transition-property

values.name: all
values.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.name: none
values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

properties.name: transition-timing-function
properties.description: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

properties.name: unicode-bidi

values.name: bidi-override
values.description: Inside the element, reordering is strictly in sequence according to the 'direction' property; the implicit part of the bidirectional algorithm is ignored.

values.name: embed
values.description: If the element is inline-level, this value opens an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. The direction of this embedding level is given by the 'direction' property.

values.name: isolate
values.description: The contents of the element are considered to be inside a separate, independent paragraph.

values.name: isolate-override
values.description: This combines the isolation behavior of 'isolate' with the directional override behavior of 'bidi-override'

values.name: normal
values.description: The element does not open an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. For inline-level elements, implicit reordering works across element boundaries.

values.name: plaintext
values.description: For the purposes of the Unicode bidirectional algorithm, the base directionality of each bidi paragraph for which the element forms the containing block is determined not by the element's computed 'direction'.

properties.syntax: normal | embed | isolate | bidi-override | isolate-override | plaintext
properties.description: The level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm.

properties.description: @font-face descriptor. Defines the set of Unicode codepoints that may be supported by the font face for which it is declared.

properties.name: user-select

values.name: all
values.description: The content of the element must be selected atomically

values.name: contain
values.description: UAs must not allow a selection which is started in this element to be extended outside of this element.

values.name: none
values.description: The UA must not allow selections to be started in this element.

values.name: text
values.description: The element imposes no constraint on the selection.

properties.description: Controls the appearance of selection.

properties.name: vertical-align

values.name: auto
values.description: Align the dominant baseline of the parent box with the equivalent, or heuristically reconstructed, baseline of the element inline box.

values.name: baseline
values.description: Align the 'alphabetic' baseline of the element with the 'alphabetic' baseline of the parent element.

values.name: bottom
values.description: Align the after edge of the extended inline box with the after-edge of the line box.

values.name: middle
values.description: Align the 'middle' baseline of the inline element with the middle baseline of the parent.

values.name: sub
values.description: Lower the baseline of the box to the proper position for subscripts of the parent's box. (This value has no effect on the font size of the element's text.)

values.name: super
values.description: Raise the baseline of the box to the proper position for superscripts of the parent's box. (This value has no effect on the font size of the element's text.)

values.name: text-bottom
values.description: Align the bottom of the box with the after-edge of the parent element's font.

values.name: text-top
values.description: Align the top of the box with the before-edge of the parent element's font.

values.name: top
values.description: Align the before edge of the extended inline box with the before-edge of the line box.

properties.syntax: baseline | sub | super | text-top | text-bottom | middle | top | bottom | <percentage> | <length>
properties.description: Affects the vertical positioning of the inline boxes generated by an inline-level element inside a line box.

properties.name: visibility

values.name: collapse
values.description: Table-specific. If used on elements other than rows, row groups, columns, or column groups, 'collapse' has the same meaning as 'hidden'.

values.name: hidden
values.description: The generated box is invisible (fully transparent, nothing is drawn), but still affects layout.

values.name: visible
values.description: The generated box is visible.

properties.description: Specifies whether the boxes generated by an element are rendered. Invisible boxes still affect layout (set the 'display' property to 'none' to suppress box generation altogether).

properties.name: -webkit-animation

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-delay
properties.description: Defines when the animation will start.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-direction

values.name: alternate
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

values.name: alternate-reverse
values.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

values.name: normal
values.description: Normal playback.

values.name: reverse
values.description: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

properties.description: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-duration
properties.description: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-fill-mode

values.name: backwards
values.description: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

values.name: both
values.description: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

values.name: forwards
values.description: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

values.name: none
values.description: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

properties.description: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-iteration-count

values.name: infinite
values.description: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

properties.description: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-name

values.name: none
values.description: No animation is performed

properties.description: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-play-state

values.name: paused
values.description: A running animation will be paused.

values.name: running
values.description: Resume playback of a paused animation.

properties.description: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

properties.name: -webkit-animation-timing-function
properties.description: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

values.name: none
values.description: No filter effects are applied.

values.name: blur()
values.description: Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.

values.name: brightness()
values.description: Applies a linear multiplier to input image, making it appear more or less bright.

values.name: contrast()
values.description: Adjusts the contrast of the input.

values.name: drop-shadow()
values.description: Applies a drop shadow effect to the input image.

values.name: grayscale()
values.description: Converts the input image to grayscale.

values.name: hue-rotate()
values.description: Applies a hue rotation on the input image.

values.name: invert()
values.description: Inverts the samples in the input image.

values.name: opacity()
values.description: Applies transparency to the samples in the input image.

properties.description: Applies a filter effect where the first filter in the list takes the element's background image as the input image.

properties.name: -webkit-backface-visibility
properties.description: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

properties.name: -webkit-background-clip
properties.description: Determines the background painting area.

properties.name: -webkit-background-origin
properties.description: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

properties.name: -webkit-border-image

values.name: auto
values.description: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

values.name: fill
values.description: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

values.name: repeat
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

values.name: round
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

values.name: space
values.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The image is stretched to fill the area.

properties.description: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

properties.name: -webkit-box-align

values.name: baseline
values.description: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

values.name: center
values.description: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

values.name: stretch
values.description: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

properties.description: Specifies the alignment of nested elements within an outer flexible box element.

properties.name: -webkit-box-direction

values.name: normal
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

values.name: reverse
values.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

properties.description: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-direction specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

properties.name: -webkit-box-flex
properties.description: Specifies an element's flexibility.

properties.name: -webkit-box-flex-group
properties.description: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

properties.name: -webkit-box-ordinal-group
properties.description: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

properties.name: -webkit-box-orient

values.name: block-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented along the box's axis.

values.name: horizontal
values.description: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

values.name: inline-axis
values.description: Elements are oriented vertically.

values.name: vertical
values.description: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

properties.description: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

properties.name: -webkit-box-pack

values.name: center
values.description: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

values.name: end
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

values.name: justify
values.description: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

values.name: start
values.description: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

properties.description: Specifies alignment of child elements within the current element in the direction of orientation.

properties.name: -webkit-box-reflect

values.name: above
values.description: The reflection appears above the border box.

values.name: below
values.description: The reflection appears below the border box.

values.name: left
values.description: The reflection appears to the left of the border box.

values.name: right
values.description: The reflection appears to the right of the border box.

properties.description: Defines a reflection of a border box.

properties.name: -webkit-box-sizing

values.name: border-box
values.description: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.

values.name: content-box
values.description: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

properties.description: Box Model addition in CSS3.

values.name: normal
values.description: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

properties.description: This property provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

values.name: auto
values.description: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

values.name: manual
values.description: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities

values.name: none
values.description: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

properties.description: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

properties.description: Specifies line-breaking rules for CJK (Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) text.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-clip
properties.description: Determines the mask painting area, which determines the area that is affected by the mask.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-image

values.name: none
values.description: Counts as a transparent black image layer.

values.name: url()
values.description: Reference to a <mask element or to a CSS image.

properties.description: Sets the mask layer image of an element.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-origin
properties.description: Specifies the mask positioning area.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-repeat
properties.description: Specifies how mask layer images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

properties.name: -webkit-mask-size

values.name: auto
values.description: Resolved by using the image's intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image's intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

values.name: contain
values.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

values.name: cover
values.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

properties.description: Specifies the size of the mask layer images.

properties.name: -webkit-nbsp-mode
properties.description: Defines the behavior of nonbreaking spaces within text.

properties.name: -webkit-overflow-scrolling
properties.description: Specifies whether to use native-style scrolling in an overflow:scroll element.

properties.name: -webkit-perspective

values.name: none
values.description: No perspective transform is applied.

properties.description: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

properties.name: -webkit-perspective-origin
properties.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

properties.name: -webkit-region-fragment

values.name: auto
values.description: Content flows as it would in a regular content box.

values.name: break
values.description: If the content fits within the CSS Region, then this property has no effect.

properties.description: The 'region-fragment' property controls the behavior of the last region associated with a named flow.

properties.name: -webkit-text-size-adjust

values.name: auto
values.description: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

values.name: none
values.description: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

properties.description: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

properties.name: -webkit-transform

values.name: matrix()
values.description: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

values.name: matrix3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

values.name: perspective()
values.description: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

values.name: rotate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

values.name: rotate3d()
values.description: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

values.name: rotateX('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

values.name: rotateY('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

values.name: rotateZ('angle')
values.description: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

values.name: scale()
values.description: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

values.name: scale3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

values.name: scaleX()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleY()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

values.name: scaleZ()
values.description: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

values.name: skew()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

values.name: skewX()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

values.name: skewY()
values.description: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

values.name: translate()
values.description: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

values.name: translate3d()
values.description: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

values.name: translateX()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

values.name: translateY()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

values.name: translateZ()
values.description: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

properties.description: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

properties.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

properties.description: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-origin-y
properties.description: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-origin-z
properties.description: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

properties.name: -webkit-transform-style

values.name: flat
values.description: All children of this element are rendered flattened into the 2D plane of the element.

properties.description: Defines how nested elements are rendered in 3D space.

values.name: all
values.description: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

values.description: No property will transition.

properties.description: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

properties.name: -webkit-transition-duration
properties.description: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

properties.name: -webkit-transition-property

values.name: none

properties.name: -webkit-transition-timing-function

properties.name: -webkit-user-select
properties.description: Controls the appearance of selection.

properties.description: Specifies the minimum number of line boxes of a block container that must be left in a fragment after a break.

properties.name: width

values.name: auto
values.description: The width depends on the values of other properties.

values.name: fit-content
values.description: Use the fit-content inline size or fit-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

values.name: max-content
values.description: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

values.name: min-content
values.description: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

properties.description: Specifies the width of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

properties.name: will-change

values.name: auto
values.description: Expresses no particular intent.

values.name: contents
